week3.practice3_html:
What it is

â€œEat More Good Fatsâ€ means adding omegaâ€‘3 rich foods or supplements so your scalp stays nourished and inflammation calms down â€” creating a steady foundation for new growth.

Why this practice matters for you now

Youâ€™re in the stabilization phase: shedding has slowed, and baby hairs are already showing. But ongoing stress keeps your follicles under pressure. With your diet low in omegaâ€‘3s (just 1â€“2 servings a month), this is the domino that brings calm to your scalpâ€™s environment, helping fragile baby hairs mature into visible strands as you move toward regrowth. This is your lever to tip balance back in your favor.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Choose two meals a week to include fatty fish (salmon, sardines, or mackerel) or a plant-based omegaâ€‘3 source like chia seeds or flax.
  2. If you use a supplement, look for fish oil or algae oil marked high in EPA & DHA, and discard any that smells â€œfishyâ€â€”that means itâ€™s rancid.
  3. Pair omegaâ€‘3s with meals that contain some protein, so your body absorbs them more effectively.
  4. Limit processed seed oils (like soybean or corn oils) that crowd out the benefits of omegaâ€‘3s.

What to look for

  • Early wins: scalp feels less tight or itchy within 1â€“2 weeks; improved energy or steadier mood; slight sheen coming back to your strands.
  • Watch-outs: You sometimes lean on alcohol for stress relief â€” paired with low sleep, this can blunt omegaâ€‘3â€™s benefits. Quick fix: commit to one extra â€œno-drink nightâ€ this week and notice the difference.
  • Consistency builds momentum â€” keep layering these fats into your week and your hair will thank you strand by strand. ğŸŒ±
